title: Whats the point of removing niche items?
body:
I'd understand if it was game changing-ly strong but its not very useful on most champions.

Is it about enforcing the Meta™️ builds? or is it too hard to balance?

If it doesn't bother many people then why screw the few who reliably use it? I mean you aren't improving the quality of the game but you're going out of your way to sabotage the select few

My internet is garbage rn and I've only see the boards post about it so if I'm missing something please let me know. Rant over

Edit- I'm referring to ZZ'Rot and Ohmwrecker

replies.body: Riot wants everyone to play one style, fast paced one shot meta.

> [{quoted}](name=Harden Stepback,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Y5Q9wTV4,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-10-24T19:02:54.959+0000)
>
> Riot wants everyone to play one style, fast paced one shot meta.

Indeed. 
Get ready for Season 10, and remember that (almost) nobody thought that S9 could have been worse than S8.

But these people are.. Too _competent_.

Which is why this game is almost dead, queue times are 4-5 times longer than they were in season 2-5. Only Chinese are still playing on mass and they are the ones funding the game so logically they pander to their brainless preferences of mobile-like games with 1 shots and 12 minute games. I love China as a country and as a culture in general, but when it comes to gaming they are slowly ruining it for everyone else with their low attention span and rigid culture (rip skellies, blood, black people etc.)

I would 100% understand if they replaced them, reworked them.

But what's the damn point of losing more tank items and getting no compensation? Even if they are niche. Sanguine blade we defo need tho, and we aren't removing any of the other lethalities are we now?

There are plenty of replacements for {{item:3056}} and {{item:3512}}.

{{item:3193}} {{item:3190}} {{item:3109}} {{item:3800}} {{item:3001}}. These items are even relevant the entire length of the game, and/or aren't already obsolete by the time they're built.

Remove the 2 items with mana, then remove the support items. And you will see why manaless tanks have such a hard time itemising.

There is a severe lack in tank options. If I want to build 5 MR items or 5 Armor items on a manaless champ in am really having only one route. Especially if I am not a support champion.
....What manaless tanks exist?

{{champion:36}} for example. And before you start spouting nonsense about "it's not a tank it's a juggernaut" no. He builds only tank items, he is a tank

> He builds only tank items, he is a tank

Uh, no, he isn't a tank. He's *Tanky*, like several juggernauts, but his entire role is damage, with his main weakness being kiting. Barebones juggernaut. The only tank that you can point towards is Shen, who've I really doubt Zzrot is such a core, important item for him, that he'll be hurt by it's removal.
{{champion:154}} ?

That's not how this works. Mundo may only build tank items, but he is a juggernaut. His biggest needs are HP and resistances. I have a hard time believing that the removal of Ohmwrecker and Zz'rot will fuck him over.

> [{quoted}](name=Academy Kayn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Y5Q9wTV4,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2019-10-25T00:17:52.944+0000)

> ....What manaless tanks exist?

not him but BIG HINT. hes a ninja that likes balance. althought tbh Shen feels like more of a bruiser nowadays than anything. Q damage is real and W really kinda sucks outside of 1v1's in a vacum

The bigger problem is how tanks are forced to dump so much of their hypothetically reduced income (since they typically aren't getting kill credits or turret plating) into mana - a resource that does not "help" them at all.

I spend 900 gold {{item:3024}} _**on a pittance of armor**_ and you get a vampiric scepter. 

For 200g _less_, you get almost as much AD as i get armor. 

Tanks want to buy {{item:3071}} - it's an item focused on health cdr and debuffing enemies for your carries to deal more damage. They can't. 

Tanks want to buy {{item:3025}} - 2700g spent on NO HEALTH, and will eventually only give half of it's armor value as a result of Conq/Cleaver/last whisper? They can't.

Tanks want to buy {{item:3068}} - Never trigger demolish and you push the wave by default. Two things that literally compound each other to make your lane untenable. They can't.

The question framed by Saezio is completely valid. Tank items SUCK BALLS as a result of being tied to _**a stat tanks don't want. **_

{{item:3070}} {{champion:98}} I feel you. Tanks desperately need an item rework. But Mundo is still a juggernaut, even if he builds tank items. The class of a champion is determined by their kit and gameplay, not the items they build.
riot would never streamline the game, it's not like malphite is a squishy assassin now or anything

nobody should counter anyone and the match should rely solely on the cumulative Micro and Macro skill of the teams and individual teammates, otherwise first pick will always lose and last pick will always win assuming flexible and capable players.

> [{quoted}](name=Hammermancer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Y5Q9wTV4,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-10-24T20:49:26.279+0000)

Counterpicks are part of the game. The ADC has a Vayne? Teemo can f her up.
Got an Irelia who wants to hop around 50 times? Poppy's grabbing her hammer.
Enemy's a heavy ap comp? Take the rune that gives you a small spellshield if you think you can't dodge enough.

If you think counters shouldn't exist then you don't really understand how games in general work.

Counters don't GUARANTEE a win, they increase your win chance.

Because you completely shut another player out of being able to play the game, thus they increase your win chance based on a non-skill related factor which starts on spawn as opposed to counter through itemization (Which can be counter itemized), or counter through smart play. It's not smart, it's cheap

Irelia has 0 options? She can still stun, use her damage reduction, ult, and auto attack. Poppy has to rely on pushing her opponent into a wall for the stun to deal max damage, Irelia's damage is more reliable. 

Counterpicks don't mean you don't get to play the game, it means you have to change HOW you play, and sometimes that means you'll have to play a way you don't want to or feel the most comfortable with.

It's simple forethought. By each champion's nature, a certain champion will have a much easier time dealing with one over another. It's how MOBAs, MMOs, and most multiplayer games are designed. It kinda seems like you just want a typical shoot shoot shooter, where whoever has the swiftest draw (read: best ping and fps) win. And then you'd complain about campers.
Then remove every champion and only make 1 so that every 10 champions in the game are the same ones so only skill of the player matters.

{{item:3115}} is a niche item. It's only taken on a select few champions ({{champion:17}} {{champion:268}} {{champion:131}}) and can sometimes pop up in off builds of other champions (like {{champion:145}}).

{{item:3056}} is not a niche item. I cannot actually tell you the last time I ever saw this item in a game where I myself did not pity build the thing. A niche item means it has specialized uses, but it still requires the item to be used AT SOME POINT.
{{item:3512}} had also dropped pretty close to no use, as I've only seen it extremely rarely. It had been previously nerfed into near oblivion, and the optimization of gear for champions who would have potentially used it had shoved it out.

Fun detected.

They aren't niche items, they are just non-existent in play. Who builds ohmwrecker under any circumstance other than someone whos trolling? ZZ'Rot gives no stats for its cost to make up for the amazing active it has, except its active is actually garbage... Both of these items are only purchased and shown to be effective when you are winning (and would just be more effective to purchase an actual item), and both items show to still produce a loss when losing. They have incredibly situational actives that nobody cares enough to go out of their way to get.

So just like other items in the past, goodbye useless and broken items with no redeemable factors.
Just because you don't build the item/items doesn't mean other people don't I personally use zz'rot a lot as a way to split and might I say it's not useless even with the nerfs to it.

I can see people wanting to keep zz'rot but Ohmwrecker is a dead item. Looking at leagueofgraphs it has a 0.0% pickrate.

So compared to Ohmwrecker the portal at least gets bought, even if it's only 0.2% of the time.

For less gold you can have sheen and tiamat, which takes turrets faster and clears minions faster for splitting. Also both items help dueling where Zzrot does nothing but a poor statline for its gold. The only reason you are purchasing Zz is for its active, and its active is just outdone by better split pushing core items.

I think it's just basic logistics, having an item that is legit never built seriously ever just doesn't make sense, it takes up space both in code and visually and usually these items are bought to grief, I mean I wouldn't be surprised if riot had a bot that auto reports anyone who builds omwreaker for griefing.
Ohmwrecker is used for diving I'll admit I normally don't see it built however it is useful for what its meant for. Diving

Just like season 9, they want to make sure the right click marksmen will own the game, and give assassins the ability to snowball hard without being shut down.
Riot wants the game to be 1 shot game mode, and I hate to admit it but it's true
Unless they change their mind and respect the tank mains, but we never know if they'll do that. Remember, they will do the impossible to make more money for their company, which means, by allowing the assassins and marksmen to have all the space and safety they want will eventually force the worlds to have such a quick rushy games, and that's their main goal
They want the WORLDS to have an easy 1 shot kills lucky matches, so no more skills required.

That's how Rito James does things. It's the same approach they take with champions and game modes as well. If only a small minority uses said thing, it's basically the same as no one using it (in their eyes) and deserves to be removed.

RIP Sanguine Blade, Madred's Bloodrazor, Zephyr. 

I enjoyed these items on Trundle, one of the few champs these items were great on, and right now his itemization is lackluster at best.

Ohmwrecher had his niche. Like a 3 Assasin team comp vs a turtle team. Rare, but hey why remove the option?
ZZ rot on the other hand, it was a decent item for tanks that dont need mana to pus.

Such items add depth, even if a little and since they already are there why remove them?
Who knows the reason why Riot does anything these days
